transliteration: Kaahn Joo Jo Toum Jeet Kai Bhoopat Chhodh(i) Dayo Tih Oj Janaayo|| Pai Dal Teees Chhodhhan Lai San Teees Chhodhhan Lai San Teees Baar Su Juddh Machadyo||
translation: “O Krishna ! the Jarasandh whom you had released, he is again demonstrating his strength; you had fought with his extremely large twenty-three military units for twenty-three times,

gurmukhi: kwnH ko AMq Bjwih rhXo mQurw ky ibKY rhny hU n pwXo ]byc kY KweI hY lwj mno iqn XO jV Awpn ko grbwXo ]2308]
transliteration: Kaahn Ko Ant Bhajaahe Rahyo Mathuraa Ke Bikhai Rahne Hoo Ko Gadbaayo||2303||
translation: “And he had ultimately caused you to run away from Matura; that fool has now no shame left in him and has been puffed up with pride.”2308.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI dsm iskMD purwxy bic`qR nwtk gRMQy kiRSnwvqwry kQnM ]
transliteration: It(i) Sridasam Sikandh Puraane Bachitra Naatak Granthe Krishnaavataarre Kathanan||
translation: End of the description in Krishnavatara (based on Dasham Skandh Purana) in Bachittar Natak.

transliteration: Ath Dilliko Aavan Raajsooe Jagg Karan Kathanan||
translation: Now begins the description of coming to Delhi and the performance of Raj Sui Yajna.

gurmukhi: qb lau nwrd kiRSn kI sBw phUicE Awie ]id`lI kO biRjnwQ ko lY cilE sMg lÍwie ]2309]
transliteration: Tab Lau Naarad Krishan Kisabhaa Pahoochio Aae|| Dillikau Brijnaath Ko Lai Chadio San Lvaae||2309||
translation: Till that time, Narada came of coming of Krishana and taking him alongwith him, he went to watch Delhi.2309

transliteration: Srribrijnaath Kahisabh Sau Ham Dillichalai Kidho Taahiko Mdarai|| Jo Mat Vaaran Ke Man Bheetar Aavat Hai Sooo Baat Bichdarai||
translation: Krishna said to all, “We are going towards Delhi in order to kill that Jarashandh and the idea that has cropped up in the minds of our zealous warriors,

gurmukhi: aUDv AYso khXo pRB jU piRQmY Pun id`lI kI Er isDwrY ]pwrQ BIm ko lY sMg Awpny qO iqh S`qR ko jwie sMGwrY ]2310]
transliteration: Oodhav Aiso Kahyo Prabh Joo Prithmai Phoun Dillikior Sidhdarai|| Paarath Bheem Ko Lai San Aapane Tau Tih Shattra Ko Jaae Sanhdarai||2310||
translation: Thinking about that, we are going there, Udhava also told this to the people that taking Arjuna and Bhima, with him, Krishna will kill the enemy.2310.

transliteration: Oodhav Jo Sabh Shattra Kau Daar(i) Kahio Su Sabhai Har(i) Maan Layo|| Rathpat(i) Bhale Gadbaajan Ke Brijnaaik Sain Bhale Rachayo||
translation: Everyone agreed with Udhava regarding the killing of the enemy; Krishna prepared his army taking with him the chariot-riders, elephants and horses,
